### Nothing you are about to see is real. For real.

You are about to see:

- Photos that are not real photos
- Paintings that are not real paintings
- People, places and things that **do not exist**.

The images you are about to see were created by DALL-E 2.
:::
::::

## DALL-E 2 {background-image="img/uDtfeUO.png" background-size="1400px"}

## What is DALL-E?

::::{.columns}
:::{.column width="50%"}
![](img/robot-drawing.jpg){width=60% fig-align="center"}

<!-- With **AI**, computers can perform tasks that are typically done by people, including processing language, problem-solving, and learning. -->
**DALL-E** is a new Artificial Intelligence (AI) system that can create realistic images and art from a description in natural language.
:::
:::{.column width="50%"}


- It was created by a company called Open AI.

- The model was created using a massive database of 650 million images with their captions.

- The name is a portmanteau of 'Dali' (as in Salvador) and Pixar's 'WALL-E'.
:::
::::


## How DALL-E works? 

- Creates images from scratch based on a text prompt
- Creates edits of an existing image based on a new text prompt
- Creates variations of an existing image
<!-- 
[DALLE-2 intro video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qTgPSKKjfVg) -->

{{< video https://youtu.be/qTgPSKKjfVg width="500" height="350" >}}

## How to use it?

Write a sentence of 400 characters or less, here are some examples:

- A portrait of a dog in a library
- A 3D render of a teapot in the shape of a king with red hair
- A dinosaur having a piano lesson, digital art.

## Some keywords

- 3D render
- Oil painting
- Photo
- Portrait
- Cartoon
- Sketch
- Comic book
- Digital art

## Artists

- Impressionisms: Claude Monet and Van Gogh
- Surrealism: Salvador Dalí
- Cubism: Pablo Picasso and Henri Matisse
- Expressionism: Edvard Munch
- Pop Art: Andy Warhol
